blog.title: Argue just to argue and I'll become dismissive.
blog.description: INTP | Obsessed with Tolkien's world | ASOIAF fan | Anti GOT because I'm over the continuous misogynistic shit from Dumb&Dumber - this is a D&D hate blog | I stan Daenerys Targaryen | VIP Bigbang fan | Blackjack 2NE1 fan | Neverland (G)I-DLE fan | Evillious Chronicles fan | Manwë, Varda, Sauron, Maglor, Lúthien, Shiera Seastar, Alysanne Targaryen, Rhaena Targaryen, and Daenerys Targaryen, and Arianne Martell are my favorite characters | Pro-House Targaryen, deal with it | I ship Manwë/Varda, Finwë/Míriel, Fëanor/Nerdanel, Fingolfin/Anairë, Finarfin/Eärwen, Aldarion/Erendis, Beren/Lúthien, Celegorm/Lúthien, Thingol/Melian, Aragorn/Arwen, Michaela/Clarith, Jaehaerys/Alysanne, Bloodraven/Shiera, Daenerys/Jon | Relationships that interest me the most are Manwë & Melkor, Sauron & Melkor, Melian & Sauron, Sauron & Ar-Pharazôn, Lúthien & Celegorm, Fëanor & Fingolfin & Finarfin, Brynden & Shiera, and Rhaegar Targaryen & Elia Martell | Don't bother arguing with me for the sake of being argumentative because I will become dismissive of you | Header by Yi

summary: Hi there! This is my main blog but I run @daenerysjon and I just wanted to say thanks for standing up to antis on that one post...
question: Hi there! This is my main blog but I run @daenerysjon and I just wanted to say thanks for standing up to antis on that one post of mine. They get so annoying that I normally don't reply, just block and move on as I feel that no matter what we say they'll hate her regardless. but I do appreciate you standing up to them, means a lot! Have a nice day/ night! <3
answer: My pleasure. It’s astounding for me personally, seeing people jump to the conclusion that Daenerys is going mad because she killed Dickon and Randyll. It’s like…every other ruler shows less mercy than she did in that situation? I just found it ridiculous and responded. I’m glad I could debunk such a senseless argument and I will continue to do so.

reblog.comment: My pleasure. It’s astounding for me personally, seeing people jump to the conclusion that Daenerys is going mad because she killed Dickon and Randyll. It’s like…every other ruler shows less mercy than she did in that situation? I just found it ridiculous and responded. I’m glad I could debunk such a senseless argument and I will continue to do so.

It’s like…every other ruler shows less mercy than she did in that situation? I just found it ridiculous and responded. I’m glad I could debunk such a senseless argument and I will continue to do so.

tags: this site has turned me into a petty being and it's too late now
summary: The logical part of me: it’s okay for characters to get a tragic ending  and even my favourites don’t have to get everything or...
body:
The logical part of me: it’s okay for characters to get a tragic ending  and even my favourites don’t have to get everything or anything actually.

The petty part of me: after all the bullshit I’ve seen in Dany’s tag and the constant misogynist hate on her, she better get not only a happy ending but also everything she ever wanted. EVERYTHING.

reblog.comment:

The petty part of me: after all the bullshit I’ve seen in Dany’s tag and the constant misogynist hate on her, she better get not only a happy ending but also everything she ever wanted. EVERYTHING.

tags: daenerys targaryen: destroying sarcasm by genuinity since 284 AC
summary: “The realm will rise for its rightful king. Tyrell, Redwyne, Darry, Greyjoy, they have no more love for the Usurper than I do....
body:
“The realm will rise for its rightful king. Tyrell, Redwyne, Darry, Greyjoy, they have no more love for the Usurper than I do. The Dornishmen burn to avenge Elia and her children. And the smallfolk will be with us. They cry out for their king.“ [Viserys] looked at Illyrio anxiously. "They do, don’t they?”

“They are your people, and they love you well,” Magister Illyrio said amiably. “In holdfasts all across the realm, men lift secret toasts to your health while women sew dragon banners and hide them against the day of your return from across the water.”

Dany had no agents, no way of knowing what anyone was doing or thinking across the narrow sea, but she mistrusted Illyrio’s sweet words as she mistrusted everything about Illyrio. – Dany I, AGOT

Ser Barristan went to one knee before her. “My queen, your realm has need of you. You are not wanted here, but in Westeros men will flock to your banners by the thousands, great lords and noble knights. ‘She is come,’ they will shout to one another, in glad voices. ‘Prince Rhaegar’s sister has come home at last.’ ”

“If they love me so much, they will wait for me.” Dany stood. – Dany III, ADWD

Meanwhile in Westeros:

“Furthermore, the Targaryens are all dead.”

“Not all,” said Alleras. “The Beggar King had a sister.”

“I thought her head was smashed against a wall,” said Roone.

“No,” said Alleras. “It was Prince Rhaegar’s young son Aegon whose head was dashed against the wall by the Lion of Lannister’s brave men. We speak of Rhaegar’s sister, born on Dragonstone before its fall. The one they called Daenerys.”

“The Stormborn. I recall her now.” Mollander lifted his tankard high, sloshing the cider that remained. “Here’s to her!” He gulped, slammed his empty tankard down, belched, and wiped his mouth with the back of his hand. “Where’s Rosey? Our rightful queen deserves another round of cider, wouldn’t you say?”

Soon the silver queen would come forth from her city, smash the Yunkai'i, and break their chains, they whispered to one another.

And then she’ll bake us all a lemon pie and kiss our widdle wounds and make them better, the dwarf thought.- Tyrion X, ADWD

Meanwhile in Meereen:

Dany walked right past him. There was an old man on the ground a few feet away, moaning and staring up at the grey belly of the clouds. She knelt beside him, wrinkling her nose at the smell, and pushed back his dirty grey hair to feel his brow. “His flesh is on fire. I need water to bathe him. Seawater will serve. Marselen, will you fetch some for me? I need oil as well, for the pyre. Who will help me burn the dead?” – Dany VI, ADWD

summary: Faltam dois meses para a última temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos é há 14 novas fotos para...
caption:
Faltam dois meses para a última temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos é há 14 novas fotos para ver https://trendy.pt/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/Game-of-Thrones-14-Temporada-8-1.jpg

Quando estivermos a 14 de Fevereiro, vão faltar exactamente dois meses para estrear a última temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos. E a HBO acaba de partilhar catorze novas fotos das filmagens.

O 14 está muito associado ao mês de Fevereiro, por causa do Dia de São Valentim. Mas, este ano, para os fãs de Game of Thrones o amor manifesta-se de outra maneira: a ver as novas fotografias da oitava temporada da série.

A HBO acaba de partilhar uma colecção com catorze fotografias com Jon Snow, Daenerys Targaryen, Sansa Stark, Tyrion Lannister e outras grandes surpresas.

Curiosamente, a última vez que tínhamos ouvido falar de A Guerra dos Tronos tinha sido a… 14 de Janeiro, altura em que a HBO lançou no YouTube um teaser enigmático com Jon Snow, Ayra Stark e Sansa Stark a entrar numa cripta.

Este vídeo marcou ainda o momento em que foi anunciada a data de estreia da oitava e última temporada de Game of Thrones: o tal dia 14 de Abril.

No princípio de Janeiro tinha saído um outro pequeno clip, que fez parte de um vídeo promocional da HBO com as novidades de 2019 (mostrado durante os Globos de Ouro).

Com cerca de cinco segundos, este preview mostrava Daenerys Targaryen a chegar acompanhada de Jorah Mormont a um local onde estão vários soldados e onde os esperam Jon Snow e Sansa Stark.

De uma rainha para outra, Sansa diz: «Winterfell is yours, your grace»: esta é a única (mas poderosa) linha de diálogo que o clip de Game of Thrones tem.

Ainda em 2018, no primeiro dia de Novembro, já tínhamos ficado a saber como ia começar esta última temporada de uma série da HBO que conquistou milhões de fãs em todo o mundo – se não liga muito a spoilers pode ler tudo aqui.

E já que falamos em HBO, também já sabemos que o serviço de streaming desta produtora vai entrar em Portugal oficialmente pela mão da Vodafone – o anúncio será feito dia 12 de Fevereiro em conferência de imprensa.

Mas vamos ao que interessa: aqui estão as 14 fotos da oitava temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos que a HBO partilhou esta semana com os fãs.

https://is.gd/LZfGXg

trail.content_raw:
Faltam dois meses para a última temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos é há 14 novas fotos para ver https://trendy.pt/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/Game-of-Thrones-14-Temporada-8-1.jpg

Quando estivermos a 14 de Fevereiro, vão faltar exactamente dois meses para estrear a última temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos. E a HBO acaba de partilhar catorze novas fotos das filmagens.

O 14 está muito associado ao mês de Fevereiro, por causa do Dia de São Valentim. Mas, este ano, para os fãs de Game of Thrones o amor manifesta-se de outra maneira: a ver as novas fotografias da oitava temporada da série.

A HBO acaba de partilhar uma colecção com catorze fotografias com Jon Snow, Daenerys Targaryen, Sansa Stark, Tyrion Lannister e outras grandes surpresas.

Curiosamente, a última vez que tínhamos ouvido falar de A Guerra dos Tronos tinha sido a… 14 de Janeiro, altura em que a HBO lançou no YouTube um teaser enigmático com Jon Snow, Ayra Stark e Sansa Stark a entrar numa cripta.

Este vídeo marcou ainda o momento em que foi anunciada a data de estreia da oitava e última temporada de Game of Thrones: o tal dia 14 de Abril.

No princípio de Janeiro tinha saído um outro pequeno clip, que fez parte de um vídeo promocional da HBO com as novidades de 2019 (mostrado durante os Globos de Ouro).

Com cerca de cinco segundos, este preview mostrava Daenerys Targaryen a chegar acompanhada de Jorah Mormont a um local onde estão vários soldados e onde os esperam Jon Snow e Sansa Stark.

De uma rainha para outra, Sansa diz: «Winterfell is yours, your grace»: esta é a única (mas poderosa) linha de diálogo que o clip de Game of Thrones tem.

Ainda em 2018, no primeiro dia de Novembro, já tínhamos ficado a saber como ia começar esta última temporada de uma série da HBO que conquistou milhões de fãs em todo o mundo – se não liga muito a spoilers pode ler tudo aqui.

E já que falamos em HBO, também já sabemos que o serviço de streaming desta produtora vai entrar em Portugal oficialmente pela mão da Vodafone – o anúncio será feito dia 12 de Fevereiro em conferência de imprensa.

Mas vamos ao que interessa: aqui estão as 14 fotos da oitava temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos que a HBO partilhou esta semana com os fãs.

https://is.gd/LZfGXg

summary: I can't figure out why Game of Thrones fandom keeps assaulting Sansa or Daenerys about the chance they might become dark Sansa...
body:
I can’t figure out why Game of Thrones fandom keeps assaulting Sansa or Daenerys about the chance they might become dark Sansa and dark Daenerys. It’s a path for fictional characters’s storylines that has been existing in literature, cinema and television since always. Always.

Character development:

  • Progression
  • Regression 

We’ve already seen and read about it in the medias, so which is the reason that make you assault them so violently? Why? Explain it to me, because fictional characters going through a character regression isn’t new to any of us.

I don’t understand why you’re constantly bullying both of them about it, outside the fact that I don’t think Sansa or Daenerys will exterminate everything and everyone. 

I like the memes, the well done gifsets (there are very well done gifsets about dark Sansa and dark Daenerys) and the jokes, but bullying is never, ever an option for me. 

(*) This post has no intention to debate on Daenerys’s Targaryen figure, because even if I disagree with some of her methods I still consider her a very tragical character like many others in Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire universes.
